meanings.definition: To mix or beat ingredients quickly with a utensil, such as a whisk.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys whisking eggs for breakfast every morning.
meanings.sent2: The chef was whisking the batter to make a fluffy cake.
meanings.sent3: While whisking the pancake batter, she accidentally splattered some on the wall.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were whisking around like a whirlwind, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The wind was whisking the leaves off the trees in a dance of colors.

meanings.definition: The act of whisking or mixing ingredients together rapidly.
meanings.sent1: The whisking of the eggs created a smooth and creamy texture.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the whisking of the milk and sugar in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The whisking of the ingredients sounded like a musical performance.
meanings.sent4: The whisking of the storm clouds signaled an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic whisking of the waves against the shore was calming.
